. Hemmed in by a strict curfew, Zahi Hawass spent the night at home fretting about the fate of his country's treasures.`` Of course I was so worried,'' he said. I have been protecting antiquities all my life. I felt if the Cairo museum is robbed, Egypt will never be able to get up again. Early Saturday, Zahi Hawass fought the mobs to reach the museum.
